ACCOUNTANT III
Senior Accountant
Results oriented accounting professional with
17+ years of progressive experience in a board range of accounting
functions.
Successful at managing multiple projects while consistently exceeding deadlines.

skills.

ACCOMPLISHMENTS

Project lead for the automation and implementation of employee expense and vendor self service modules.
Authored and established departmental check printing and ACH standard operating procedures.
Streamlined operations and eliminated one full day from month-end  closing by condensing and automating vendor project retention funds.
Automated Positive Pay and ACH notifications for faster and more reliable response time.
Project Co-lead for Oracle Payroll implementation.
Created and Implemented an employee morale initiative 'Where Everybody Counts" for the Office of Accounting.
Managed employee benevolent fund for 13 years as Secretary for the MARTA Employees Club.
Streamlined the process in which employees seek assistance and funds distributed.

PROFESSIONAL EXPERIENCE


08/2007 to Current

Capitalizes operating and project expenses according to policy.
Monitors fixed asset subledger for accuracy.
Reconciles fixed asset subledger to the general ledger control account for each class of fixed assets and resolves any reconciling items monthly.
Codes/reclass invoices for fixed asset purchases with the appropriate general ledger account number, business unit or cost center.
Audits invoices prior to payment for accuracy and compliance in accordance with accounting and Authority guidelines and statue.
Responsible for over fifty high volume contracts, ensuring accuracy and compliance with contracts terms, GAAP and authority procedures.
Manages $1M contract retainage and reconcile variances on a monthly basis.
Manages $5M operating accruals account.
Post monthly to the general ledger.
Reconciles financial data for the purpose of maintaining accurate account balances and ensuring compliance with established accounting procedure.
Monitors account balances and related financial activity to ensure that allocations are accurate and comply with established financial practices.
Verify appropriate approvals of invoices, investigate and resolve issues.
Trains staff and/or outside vendors regarding procedural requirements for transaction processing.
Collaborates with project managers, purchasing agents, contract administrators and accounting specialist regarding procedural requirements for the purpose of processing transactions.
Researches discrepancies of financial information and/or documentation to for the purpose of ensuring the accuracy and adhering to established procedures prior to processing.

04/1999 to 08/2007
Credit / Collections Analyst
Company Name
— City , State
Co-managed the Authority's short-term operational investment portfolios and intermediate-term reserve investment portfolios, totaling $300 million.
Completed daily cash management activities such as setting the daily cash position, funds movement and the investment of excess funds.
Prepared a rolling forecast of cash receipts and expenditures, encompassing in excess of $700 million annually.
Initiated all wire fund transfers and manages transfer database.
Reviewed, analyzed and managed MARTA's credit policy to ensure the effectiveness of credit terms and credit granting practices.
Monitored, controlled and measured performance of the accounts receivable and its aging schedule for compliance with payment standards to minimize past due accounts.
Liaison between financial institution and the Office of Corporate Finance to determine and resolve any variances with regard to financial reports.

Reconciled monthly bank statements to Spectrum Accounting and manual checkbook.
Monitored accounts detecting fraudulent activities and common bank errors.
Handled all accounts receivables, posted cash to appropriate accounts, prepared deposits and recorded transactions into the general journal.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Account Manager

Location: Houston, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Position: Account Manager
Reports to: Chief Revenue Officer
Location: Houston, TX area
Company Overview:Skylight Lending is a financial services company that specializes in providing loans to consumers for solar installations and home improvement related projects. We provide an easy to understand and seamless lending process to borrowers across the US. Our mission is to empower changemakers and provide them with the ability to easily and affordably make an impact with their homes and lives.
Role Overview:We are a tight-knit team and are looking for a highly motivated and skilled Account Manager to join us. The Account Manager is responsible for managing and nurturing client relationships, building partnerships, and growing revenue with existing installer/dealer partners. This position requires a combination of business development and client management skills to manage complex arrangements and questions related to Skylight’s loan products. The successful candidate will be motivated, detail-oriented, and possess a solid understanding of the residential lending process. The ideal candidate will have 2-4 years of experience in account management or a related field.
Roles & Responsibilities:1) Client Management: The Account Manager will be responsible for maintaining strong relationships with clients, understanding their needs, and anticipating future requirements. They will work with customers throughout the sales process, from lead generation to deal-closing, by identifying and resolving issues, increasing partner understanding, and explaining Skylight’s lending products. The account manager will also provide ongoing support to clients, ensuring their continued satisfaction with services provided.2) Business Development: As a member of the sales team, the Account Manager will be responsible for cultivating new business by developing and maintaining strong relationships with potential clients, whether through a lead generation process provided by Skylight or by generating your own leads. 3) Customer Analysis: The Account Manager will also be responsible for maintaining accurate records and reports on client activity, allowing the sales team to optimize their outreach and financial offerings.4) Cross-Functional Coordination: The Account Manager will work closely with other departments throughout the organization, including operations and finance to ensure seamless execution of projects. This will require ongoing collaboration to develop and maintain product offerings, manage risk, and ensure compliance with required regulatory and legal mandates.
Desired Characteristics:• Self-starter: This role requires someone who is comfortable working independently and is self-motivated to deliver results.• Strong interpersonal skills: The Account Manager will work closely with customers, team members, and external partners, requiring strong communication and interpersonal skills.• Team player: This position involves working alongside cross-functional teams within the organization and requires a collaborative and communicative approach.• Detail-oriented: The ideal candidate must be detail-oriented and responsible for maintaining accurate records and reports.• Passion for solar energy: A passion for renewable energy and the desire to assist clients in the transition to a solar future is essential.
Salary and Benefits:Our company offers a competitive salary and benefits packages. The salary for this position is commensurate with experience. Benefits include healthcare, dental, vision insurance, 401(k) matching, and paid time off. We are excited for the opportunity of welcoming new members to the team and encourage you to apply!

Experience Level (if available): None
<JD_END>
